message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: public int [] youMakeMeOdd(int [] arr){
    ArrayList<Integer> odds = new ArrayList<>();
    for(int i = 0; i < arr.length; i++)
    {
        if(arr[i] % 2 != 0)
        {
            odds.add(arr[i]);
        }
    }
    int[] result = new int[odds.size()];
    for(int i = 0; i < odds.size(); i++)
    {
        result[i] = odds.get(i);
    }
    return result;
}
<<<explanation>>>: The problem with your code is that you're initializing the odds array with the same length as the input array. This means that if there are any even numbers in the input array, their corresponding positions in the odds array will be filled with 0's (the default value for int in Java). To fix this, you can use an ArrayList to store the odd numbers, and then convert this ArrayList to an array before returning it. This way, the returned array will only contain the odd numbers from the input array, in the same order.
